IV.i.3.B.1.e
.
Heart Conditions Examination Report Review for METs
The metabolic equivalents (METs) score for heart conditions can be provided as an estimate, as indicated on the disability benefits questionnaires (DBQs).  If the Veteran has comorbid conditions that prevent the examiner from performing METs testing or providing an interview-based METs estimate, then the
examiner must indicate why
METs testing could not be performed, or
a METs estimate could not be provided, and
rating activity will evaluate the condition based on the remaining examination results and evidence of record.
Reference
:  For more information on rating heart conditions, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, 5
.
title: M21-1, Part IV, Subpart i, Chapter 3, Section B - Examination Sufficiency for Specific Disabilities
citation: Part IV, Subpart i, Chapter 3, Section B
